title: Saint Louis University - School of Law Prospectus Update

school_history.recommended_by: Daniel Salcedo, Assistant Director of Private Schools

course_offerings_timeline.1956: First to Third Year Law courses
course_offerings_timeline.1957: Fourth-Year Law course offered; government recognition granted for First to Third Year

vision_mission: The SLU School of Law is committed to providing excellent legal education toward the holistic formation of Christian, ethical, and competent professionals. These professionals are envisioned to serve the community and actively contribute to nation-building.
goals_and_objectives: To produce ethical, competent, and principled lawyers.
To maintain high standards of quality in legal education through adequate facilities and learning resources.
To provide free legal services to indigent members of the Baguio-Benguet community via the Chief Justice Manuel V. Moran Community Legal Assistance.
To foster students’ creativity through co- and extra-curricular activities.
office_location: Room S414, 4th Floor, Diego Silang Building, A. Bonifacio Street, 2600 Baguio City, Philippines
admission_information: General Admission Requirements and Enrollment available upon inquiry.
